column4: can anyone help me to find a driver for my asus m2n-x motherboard... it seems like i must install it manually
http://support.asus.com/download/options.aspx?SLanguage=en&type=1
ty
i found my model and i select Linux and it shows me this download list: vendor list bios
bios-utilites, others, manuals
what should i download ?
I don't think that they are supporting linux :/ I can't download linux drivers for my board too
so how can i connet to the internet with ubuntu???
are you in need of ethernet drivers?
yes  but for ubuntu
Oh but Asus don't have them, those drivers are community made but I'll try to find driver for you that you can install
i cant connect to the internet cause it tells me wired network - disconnected
hope u can find one
what is your ethernet card? realtek, atheros etc
how can i know that?
nvidia i think
on the pc with ubuntu write lspci and look for ethernet controller and post what ethernet controller you are using
ok
NVIDIA Corporation MCP65 Ethernet
nothing?
can't seem to find anything :/ the ethernet should work though I don't understand why
with windows 7 all drivers are installed automatically
but with ubundu i think not
for me it's the reverse, I have to install ethernet driver on windows 7
